conclusion: To solve this problem, we need to track the liquid flow as it passes through the baffles and enters the containers.
The green liquid flows downward after passing through the baffle labeled 'A'.
The green liquid then turns right and continues downward.
The white liquid flows downward after passing through the baffle labeled 'B'.
The white liquid then turns left and moves upward.
The pink liquid flows downward after passing through the baffle labeled 'C'.
The pink liquid then turns right and continues downward.
The black container (D) is positioned below the baffles where the liquid flows right before turning down.
The pink container (E) is positioned beneath the baffles where the liquid turns right and moves downward.
The yellow container (F) is positioned beneath the baffles where the liquid continues downward without turning.
The orange container (G) is positioned beneath the baffles where the liquid continues downward without turning.
The green liquid will flow into the pink container (E).
The white liquid will not reach any container as it turns left and moves upward.
The pink liquid will flow into the yellow container (F).
Final predictions for the containers: Green liquid -> Pink container (E), White liquid -> Not reached, Pink liquid -> Yellow container (F).
